text:
Click to email this to a friend (Opens in new window)

Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window)

Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window)

Lala Kent’s married man is finally divorced.

Randall Emmett and Ambyr Childers settled their divorce and were pronounced single on Dec. 22, per a Los Angeles County court docket. The terms of their separation and the custody agreement over their young daughters, London and Rylee, remains confidential.

“It was an amicable divorce,” Emmett’s rep told Page Six on Wednesday. “They have a healthy co-parenting relationship for their children.”

The “Power” producer, 46, first filed for separation from Childers, 29, in April 2015, but he asked the court to dismiss his petition in May 2016. Childers filed for divorce in January 2017 after Kent, 27, was accused of having an affair with an unnamed married man on “Vanderpump Rules.”

The #GiveThemLala beauty queen first appeared on Season 4 (2015-2016) of the Bravo hit show and came under fire for her love life during Season 5 (2016-2017). She quit the show midway through the season over her castmates’ claims that her over-the-top lifestyle was paid for by her then-anonymous boyfriend, but finally confessed that her Range Rover was paid for by someone else and the lies she made about her relationship gave her anxiety when she returned for Season 6 (which is currently on air).

Kent only mentioned Emmett’s name while asking a casino worker where he was in a now-deleted Instagram story from Las Vegas, but Page Six caught the couple kissing at an event in Beverly Hills earlier this month.

Childers’ rep did not immediately return our request for comment.

Kent’s rep didn’t get back to us.
title: Lala Kent’s married man officially divorced
